brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this PMS is to gain information about safety and efficacy in real practice
      as a regulatory commitment required by KFDA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients determined to start EYLEA treatment

          -  Patients who are prescribed with anti-VEGF therapy for the first time

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who previously received anti-VEGF therapy

study_pop.textblock:
Patients diagnosed with wet age-related macular degeneration(wAMD) who are decided to
        receive EYLEA (VEGF Trap Eye) treatment

intervention.description: Patients in daily life clinical practice treatment receiving EYLEA according to indication on the label.

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

clinical_study.official_title: Eylea Regulatory Post Marketing Surveillance in Korea

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse events (AEs) [including serious adverse events (SAEs) and ocular AEs, especially AEs due to intravitreal injection procedure] and adverse drug reactions (ADRs)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of BCVA (prior to injection and performing other ocular assessments) by eye chart.[BCVA: Best Corrected Visual Acuity]
Central retinal thickness by OCT with or without.[OCT: Optical Coherence Tomography]
Findings of FAG and/or ICAG. [FAG: Fluorescein Angiography
IOP(if performed, before/after injection).[IOP: Intra Ocular Pressure]
Measurement of fundus lesion by fundoscopy
Adverse events (AEs) [including serious adverse events (SAEs) and ocular AEs, especially AEs due to intravitreal injection procedure] and adverse drug reactions (ADRs)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
